result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Writ of Habeas Corpus
Writ of Habeas Corpus - FPT - 12-01-22; JT12 - 12-12-22; 12-13-22

Defendant Joshua A. Silverman not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Joshua A. Silverman.  Prosecuting attorney Samuel Thomas Berg in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Trial dates set. Minutes filed.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Prosecuting attorney James T. Sempf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua A. Silverman not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Joshua A. Silverman. Defendant was moved from DCI yesterday. Video was not able to be arranged. Cases to be re-assigned, clerk to contact parties. Minutes filed.
Original filed with court.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.

records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
with Exhibit #1 attached

2:07 PM (64-06) Defendant Joshua A. Silverman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Ashley L Renz in court for Joshua A. Silverman.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State called to the stand as a witness, Nicholas Pupp, Patrolman from the Elkhorn Police Dept.
Nicholas Pupp duly sworn by the clerk and testified on direct examination by ADA Herrmann. Witness identified the defendant on the video screen.
Exhibit #1, marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received.
Cross examination by Attorney Renz.
Evidence is closed.
Argument by ADA Herrmann, requesting bind over.
Attorney Renz objects to bind over.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds him over to stand trial on the charges. 
Attorney Renz acknowledged receipt of the Information and waived reading. Plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of her client.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua A. Silverman not in court, in custody, Attorney Ashley L Renz for Joshua A. Silverman not in court, Attorney Melissa Frost in court for Joshua Silverman. Plaintiff State of Wisconsin appeared in court by D.A., Zeke Wiedenfeld. Called @ 2:12 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for initial appearance on file 22CF129 and statuses on 21CF195 & 21CF211. Record by Atty. Frost as to new appointment of Atty. Renz on the newest file due to conflict she has. She remains attorney on the 21CF files. Further record that the defendant is in the Rock County Jail and she is not requesting him to appear as matters will just scheduled. Atty. asks that all files be set over for attorney Renz to appear on new file. Atty. is not asking that the defendant be writted over to our jail as next hearing will be just to set dates on the files. Warrant can remain for now. Court grants request and sets all matter over.
Initial appearance scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Ashley Renz
Jeramiah Maynard
